addressleaf.section:
26. July
1590.
LL. of the Counsail: restitution shalbe made to the march
a
ts of the
Provinces
.

To o
r
verie lovinge freindes Thomas Wilkes esquier one of the Clerkes of the Councell and Tho
m
s Bodeley esquier, emploied at this present in
her Ma
t
service w
th
the
Estates generall
of the United Provinces./

page.lettertext:
fol.102r
After o
r
hartie commendac
o
ns. Yo
w
shall understand that before yo
r
l
re
s
ca
m
unto us w
th
those from the States generall and of
Holland
and
Zeland
bothe to her Ma
tie
and to us, wee had given order that those
m
chant
of the
Lowe Countries
, and the Masters and Marryners here whose shippes
were taken and staied on the Seas co
m
inge out of Spaine by
S
r
John
Hawkins
and
S
r
Martine Frobisher
, should make attestac
o
n before
the Judge of the Admyralltie to whome the goodes and
m
chandize
doe belonge and thereuppon present Restituc
o
n to be made unto them.
bothe of the shippes and
m
chaundize puttinge in bandes to make restituc
o
n
of the value of so moche as uppon due proofe shall fall out to
ap
taine to Spanyard
or be unles all good
for
e warr
w
ch
her Ma
tie
was pleased should
n
telie
be executed although the said gen
t
have wrytten hether very confidentlie
that yt wilbe proved the goods in those shippes do ap
taine unto
Spanyard
and to be collored by those of that Nation; Therefore
you maie assure as well the States generall as those of Holland
and Zeland that there ys no meaninge in her Ma
tie
to impeache anie
waie their traffick so as the same be of meere
M
chaundize. Howebeit
her Ma
tie
ys certainelie advertized that under the pretence of transportinng
of
M
channdize there are amongst them that doe convey Munyc
o
n and
vic
o
n of warre into Spaine, As there be divers lykewyse that cullor
the goodes of Spanyard
in theire intercourse of Traffick; Therefore
as her Ma
tie
hathe a care that they should not be lett and interrupted
in theire Trafficke, so yo
u
maie require them that better regarde hereafter
maie be used that these abuses be not commytted wherby the com
o
n
Ennemie maie be supplied w
th
munyc
o
n and other necessarie
vic
o
n
to mayntaine the warres against her Ma
tie
.
So wee bid yo
u
hartilie
farewell. From the Court at Greenew
ch
the 26
th
of July.
1590
Yo
r
verie Lovinge freind
Christopher Hatton
: Can
c
.
William Burghley
Hunnsdon
Cobham
Buckehurst
Francis Knollys
Thomas Heneage
John Wolley
Fortescue
William Waad
Thomas Wylkes
Thomas Bodley
{esquiers.
